benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: Valid Payload: Scenarios @TC01, @TC03, @TC04, @TC05, @TC11, @TC12, @TC21, @TC22, @TC23, @TC24, @TC25, @TC26, @TC27 cover successful creation with valid data.

Invalid Payload: @TC11 (missing required fields), @TC12 (invalid email format), @TC10 (malformed JSON), @TC13 (missing required header), @TC14 (unauthorized), @TC15 (external service down), @TC17 (empty request body), @TC18 (additional query params), @TC19 (system performance), @TC20 (concurrent requests), @TC23, @TC24 (security tests) cover invalid or edge cases.

Edge Cases: Tests for non-existent account (@TC09), invalid accountId format (@TC07), missing accountId (@TC08), large payloads (@TC16), unicode characters (@TC21), injection attempts (@TC23), XSS (@TC24), and regression tests (@TC22) are included.
gaps: Authorization: No explicit tests for missing or invalid authentication tokens beyond @TC14.
Rate Limiting: No tests for handling multiple requests in rapid succession.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios testing caching headers like ETag or Cache-Control.
Pagination: No tests for retrieving multiple emails or handling large datasets with pagination.
Response Content Validation: No detailed tests verifying the structure and content of the response beyond status codes.
Retry Logic: No tests simulating transient network failures with retries (@TC25 is partial).
External dependencies: No explicit tests for database or email validation service unavailability beyond @TC15.
recommendations: Add tests for authorization headers and token validation to ensure proper access control.
Implement rate limiting tests to verify system handles high request volumes gracefully.
Include scenarios for caching headers to verify proper cache management.
Add pagination tests for listing emails if applicable, to ensure large dataset handling.
Create tests for retry mechanisms in case of transient failures.
Verify response content structure and error message clarity for better API usability.
